ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark
ygData.msgSnippet: ... There aren t any trainers because we didn t get any skills after 50 (till 53). ... Even so, now that Kunark is live, other classes have training facilities
ygData.messageBody:
>
There aren't any trainers because we didn't get any skills after 50 (till
53).
>

Even so, now that Kunark is live, other classes have training facilities on
the new continent. So maybe RoK Beta was tested by higher level PCs who
didn't need training, but it doesn't change the fact that players are now
flocking there from all level ranges, and as such, want to visit a trainer
when they level.

What about those Bards that have saved up practice points and just want to
increase a skill or learn the basics of a new language? Unlike the majority
of other classes (I think there's one other class that doesn't have a
trainer, correct me if I'm wrong), we have to travel to Kelethin or Freeport
for the privilege.

Gordon's answer of (paraphrased) "We don't want people to become totally
self-sufficient on the new continent" screams of being a cop-out. Other
classes are, why can't we?

-KS
